sub.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a substitute in sports such as football
sub.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: part of your wages that you receive earlier than usual because you need money
sub.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a long bread roll, split open and filled with meat, cheese etc
sub.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to act as a substitute for someone
sub.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Roy’s subbing for Chris in tonight’s game.
sub.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to give someone part of their wages earlier than usual or lend them money
sub.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: I subbed Fenella a tenner to get a decent bunch of flowers.
sub.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: under or below a particular level or thing
sub.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: less important or powerful than someone or something, or of lower rank than someone
sub.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: not as good as other people or things
sub.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: part of your wages that you receive earlier than usual because you need money
sub.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: to give someone part of their wages earlier than usual or lend them money
sub.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: Can you sub me £20 until pay day?
